description:
The `k-collection` component is a wrapper around `k-items`
that adds sortabilty and pagination to the items.

props.name: help
props.description: Help text to show below the collection

props.name: layout
props.description: Layout of the collection

props.name: link
props.description: Enable/disable item links

props.name: size
props.description: Size for items in cards layout

props.name: sortable
props.description: Whether the collection can be sorted

description: Whenever you have to deal with an "empty" state, such as an empty list or a search without results, you can use the `k-empty` component to make it a bit nicer.

props.name: text
props.description: Text to show inside the box

props.name: icon
props.description: Icon to show inside the box

props.name: layout
props.description: Layout for the box

props.name: buttons
props.description: Additional inline buttons in the item's footer

props.name: layout
props.description: Display layout

props.name: layout
props.description: Display layout

props.name: empty
props.description: Placeholder text and icon for empty state

props.name: size
props.description: Card sizes

description:
The Dialog mixin is intended for all components
that extend <k-dialog> It forwards the methods to
the <k-dialog> ref. Extending <k-dialog> directly
can lead to breaking methods when the methods are not
wired correctly to the right elements and refs.

props.name: cancelButton
props.description: Cancel Button Settings

props.name: disabled
props.description: Whether to disable the submit button

deprecated.description: 4.0.0 use the submit button settings instead
deprecated.title: deprecated

props.name: icon
props.description: The icon type for the submit button

deprecated.description: 4.0.0 use the submit button settings instead
deprecated.title: deprecated

props.name: submitButton
props.description: Submit button settings

props.name: theme
props.description: The theme of the submit button

deprecated.description: 4.0.0 use the submit button settings instead
deprecated.title: deprecated

methods.name: cancel
methods.description: Triggers the `@cancel` event and closes the dialog.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Triggers the `@close` event and closes the dialog.

methods.name: error
methods.description: Shows the error notification bar in the dialog with the given message

methods.name: focus
methods.description:
Sets the focus on the first usable input
or a given input by name

methods.name: input
methods.description: Updates the dialog values

methods.name: open
methods.description:
Opens the dialog and triggers the `@open` event.
Use ready to fire events that should be run as
soon as the dialog is open

methods.name: submit
methods.description:
This event is triggered when the submit button is clicked,
or the form is submitted. It can also be called manually.

methods.name: success
methods.description: Shows the success notification bar in the dialog with the given message

description: Modal dialogs are used in Kirby's Panel in many places for quick actions like adding new pages, changing titles, etc. that don't necessarily need a full new view. You can create your own modals for your fields and other plugins or reuse our existing modals to invoke typical Panel actions.

description: Dropdowns are constructed with two elements: `<k-dropdown-content>` holds any content shown when opening the dropdown: any number of `<k-dropdown-item>` elements or any other HTML; typically a `<k-button>` then is used to call the `toggle()` method on `<k-dropdown-content>`.

description: The Autocomplete component can be wrapped around any form of input to get an flexible starting point to provide an real-time autocomplete dropdown. We use it for our `TagsInput` component.

props.name: html
props.description: If set to `true`, the text of the options is rendered as HTML

props.name: limit
props.description: Maximum number of displayed results

props.name: skip
props.description: You can pass an array of strings, which should be ignored in the search.

props.name: options
props.description:
Options for the autocomplete dropdown must be passed as an array of
objects. Each object can have as many items as you like, but a text
item is required to match agains the query

example.description: [ { text: "this will be searched", id: "anything else is optional" }, ];
example.title: example

props.name: query
props.description: Term to filter options

properties.name: matches
properties.description: all options that match the search query

methods.name: search
methods.description: Opens the dropdown and filters the options

description:
Form field to handle a date/datetime value.

Bundles `k-date-input` with `k-calendar` and, optionally,
`k-time-input` with `k-times`.

Have a look at `<k-field>`, `<k-input>`
and `<k-datetime-input>` for additional information.

props.description: A unique name for the input

props.description: If `true`, the field has to be filled in correctly to be submitted

props.description: Optional text that will be shown before the input

props.description: Format to parse and display the date

props.name: max
props.description: The last allowed date as ISO date string

props.name: min

Rounding to the nearest step.
Requires an object with a `unit`
and a `size` key

Time options (e.g. `display`, `icon`, `step`).

props.description: Deactivate the times dropdown or not

description: The Fieldset component is a wrapper around manual field component creation. You simply pass it an fields object and all field components will automatically be created including a nice field grid. This is the ideal starting point if you want an easy way to create fields without having to deal with a full form element.

props.description: If `true`, form fields won't show their validation status on the fly.

methods.description: Focus a specific field in the fieldset or the first one if no name is given

methods.name: hasFieldType
methods.description: Check if a particular field type exists

methods.name: hasField
methods.description: Check if a field with the given name exists in the fieldset

events.name: submit
events.description: When the form is submitted. This can be done in most inputs by hitting enter. It can also be triggered by a field component by firing a `submit` event. This will bubble up to the form and trigger a submit there as well. This is used in the textarea component for example to link the `cmd+enter` shortcut to a submit.

description:
The Upload component is a combination of a native file input
and a dialog. The native file input is invisible and only
serves to open the file selector from the OS. Once files are
selected the dialog will open and show the progress and
potential upload errors.

For all available parameters, check out the component props.
If no additional parameters are passed, the properties from
the upload element are used.

Instead of opening the file picker first
you can also start the uploader directly,
by "dropping" a FileList from a drop event
for example.

description: The dropzone component helps to simplify creating areas, where files can be dropped and uploaded or displayed. You simply wrap it around any other element to create the zone. The dropzone will also create a focus ring around the area when the user drags files over it.

props.name: disabled
props.description: You can deactivate the dropzone with this property

events.name: drop
events.description: The drop event is triggered when files are being dropped into the dropzone.

properties.name: files
properties.description: The event receives the files list as argument, which can then be used to start an upload for example.

slots.name: default
slots.description: Everything that should be covered by the dropzone

description: Use <k-color-frame> to display a color preview.

props.name: element
props.description: HTML element to use as container

props.name: fit
props.description: Object fit value to user for the content

props.name: ratio
props.description: Aspect ratio for the container. The ratio can be defined freely with the format `widthFraction/heightFraction`.

props.name: cover
props.description: If the content doesn't fit the defined ratio, the component will add additional space around the content. You can change that behavior with the `cover` attribute. If `true`, the image will be cropped to fit the ratio.

props.name: back
props.description: Background for the frame. Either shorthand for Panel default colors or actual CSS value.

props.name: theme
props.description: Theme to use for the frame

description:
The <k-grid> component is a CSS grid wrapper. It goes very well together with the <k-column> component, which allows to set column widths in a very comfortable way. Any other element within the Grid component can be used as well though.

Customised the grid via the `--columns` CSS property on `<k-grid>` and the `--width` and/or `--span` properties on its children.

deprecated.description: 4.0.0 Use `style="gap: "` or `variant` prop instead
deprecated.title: deprecated

props.description:
Overlays are only openend on demand with the `open()` method.
If you need an overlay that's visible on creation, you can set the
`visible` prop

description:
The Draggable component implements the
[Vue.Draggable](https://github.com/SortableJS/Vue.Draggable)
library which is a wrapper for the widespread
[Sortable.js](https://github.com/RubaXa/Sortable) library.

props.description: HTML element for the wrapper

Whether to show a sort handle or, if yes,
which CSS selector to use

props.name: list
props.description: Array/object of items to sync when sorting

slots.name: default
slots.description: Items to be sortable via drag and drop

Sets the `aria-current` attribute.
Especially useful in connection with the `link` attribute.

A disabled button will have no pointer events and
the opacity is be reduced.

props.description: Force which HTML element to use

props.description: Adds an icon to the button.

props.name: link
props.description:
If the link attribute is set, the button will be represented
as a proper `a` tag with `link`'s value as `href` attribute.

props.name: responsive
props.description:
A responsive button will hide the button text on smaller screens
automatically and only keep the icon. An icon must be set in this case.
If set to `text`, the icon will be hidden instead.

props.description: `rel` attribute for when using with `link`

props.name: size

props.name: target
props.description:
In connection with the `link` attribute, you can also set the
target of the link. This does not apply to regular buttons.

props.name: text
props.description: The button text

props.name: theme
props.description: With the theme you can control the general design of the button.

props.name: title
props.description:
The title attribute can be used to add additional text
to the button, which is shown on mouseover.

description: Our Link component is a wrapper around a native HTML `a` element, but it is also used to swap this with a Vue `router-link` element in our application whenever it makes sense. It comes with a set of additional useful helpers.

props.name: to
props.description: The path or absolute URL for the link.

props.name: details
props.description:
Show/hide the details display with the page selector
in the center of the two navigation buttons.

props.name: limit
props.description: Sets the limit of items to be shown per page

props.name: page
props.description: Sets the current page

props.name: total
props.description:
Sets the total number of items that are in the paginated list.
This has to be set higher to 0 to activate pagination.

methods.name: goTo
methods.description: Jump to the given page

methods.name: prev
methods.description: Go to the previous page

methods.name: next
methods.description: Go to the next page
